attributes.action: ban models with a BMI of less than 18 from all UK catwalk shows
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
BMI is the Body Mass Index is the statistical measure of the weight in proportion to height.  Typically a BMI of less than 18.5 is considered underweight or malnourished.

Using girls with such low BMI promotes an unhealthy body image, especially to vulnerable children.

A recent survey from the British Paediatric Surveillance Unit estimates that 3.5 children in every 100,000 in the UK are treated for an eating disorder, including anorexia, bulimia and binge eating. 

Both Milan and Madrid have already introduced bans to reduce undereweight models on catwalk show.

rejection.details: Too similar to an existing petition http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/nosize0/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
